Stan Lee

"The man who brought superheroes to life"




Timeline of Stan Lee's Life:


  • 1922 - Birth Date: Born in Manhattan on 28th December.

  • 1929 - The Great Depression era: The stock market crashed and affected thousands of familys during The Great Depression. Stan helped his family by getting a part time job at a movie cinima, he was an usher.

  • 1938 - Teenage Years: Stan attended DeWitt Clinton High School during his teenage years, wanting to become a writer. He enjoyed writing and reading. He lived in a one bedroom apartment, his parents sleeping on a fold-out couch, while the brothers shared the room. He graduated high school at a young age of 16 and a half, joining WPA Federal Theatre Project.

  • 1939 - Starting Career: Lieber, who later shortened his name to "Lee" as a writer, went on to be hired as an office assistant at Timely Comics in 1939 and became an interim editor for the company in the early 1940s. Lee also served domestically in the Army during World War II, working as a writer and illustrator.

  • 1947 - Marriage: Stan eventually found his partner and got married to Joan B. lee on December 5, 1947

  • 1950 - First Child: Stan Lee eventually had his first daughter named Joan Celia Lee.

  • 1953 - Second Child: Stan Lee did have a second daughter. But sadly three days after birth, Jan Lee passed away.

  • 1960 - Co-creating the Fantastic Four: In the early '60s, Lee was called upon by his boss to create a series for Marvel Comics (Timely's new name) that could compete with rival DC Comics' hit title Justice League of America. Citing writing influences like Sir Arthur Conan Doyle and Jules Verne, and following the encouragement of his wife Joan, Lee did away with some of the usual superhero conventions. Hence, with artist and co-creator Jack Kirby, the Fantastic Four was born in 1961.

  • 1962 - Spiderman is born! The Iconic superhero we know and love today was created by Stan in 1962.

  • 1964 - Captain America makes a return! Captain America returns more even more popular than he ever was before, 20 years ago.

  • 1966 - Black Panther makes his debut: The first black superhero makes an appearance shortly after the return of Captain America.

  • 1994 - Jack Kirby passes away Stan Lees good friend and co worker, Jack Kirby passes away.

  • 2002 - Spider-Man movie (2002) Spider man gets his first live action movie in the U.S. and gace Marvel a boost in money to gain popularity and make moer comics and movies.

  • 2016 - Stan Lee: Excelsior! Stan Lee became an iconic man for the creations and heroes he had published that we all know and love today. Marvel had its own trilogy in movies and had just came out with one called "Deadpool" and the 3rd Captain America that was about to be released.

  • 2018 - Death: dies at the age of 95 in Los Angeles




"I used to be embarrassed because I was just a comic-book writer while other people were building bridges or going on to medical careers. And then I began to realize: entertainment is one of the most important things in people’s lives. Without it, they might go off the deep end. I feel that if you’re able to entertain people, you’re doing a good thing. "

-- Stan Lee
